title: [Improvement] Add Http status as a separate field in exception on not 101 HTTP response code during web socket handshake
body:
### Reason
In my project (built on top of Spring Cloud Gateway https://github.com/spring-cloud/spring-cloud-gateway) to be able to properly proxy HTTP response (on not 101 Http response code) from the backend server to the client, I need to extract actual Http Status code. For now, it could be done only by parsing the exception's message.
To simplify such use cases I'd like to introduce the sub-class of the WebSocketHandshakeException and enrich it with actual Http status to avoid extra string parsing.
### Expected behavior
In the case of the wrong Http Status during Handshake throw WrongStatusWebSocketHandshakeException (for example) with Http status as an exception field
### Actual behavior
Actual Http status code could be only obtained by parsing exception's message of the WebSocketHandshakeException.
### Steps to reproduce
Try to establish a web-socket  connection with a server which returns not 101 HttpStatus code
### Minimal yet complete reproducer code (or URL to code)
I can create a reproducible  sample, but it seems obvious from the code
https://github.com/netty/netty/blob/4.1/codec-http/src/main/java/io/netty/handler/codec/http/websocketx/WebSocketClientHandshaker13.java#L274
(same for other Handshaker implementations ).

I omitted versions since they are not relevant in this case.
